item.title: About Me
item.description:
About Me

Table of Contents
  • Who Am I?
  • Ultimate Goal


Who Am I?

Hi!! My name is Enoch Yu, a high school sophomore in South Korea. I am captivated by numerous fields, primarily mathematics, programming, and music. The beauty of logic behind symbols and codes in mathematics and programming stimulated to hope to further study both pure mathematics and computer science in university.

If one word can describe myself, it is the word perseverance. I believe that the ability to not surrender to a problem due to difficulty is one of the most beautiful qualities of a human being. Consequently, one strength that I am proud of is the ability to persist. For instance, despite numerous failures in mathematics such as not being qualified to represent Korea for the International Mathematical Olympiad, I continue to assiduously pursue mathematics. Considering failures as another challenge and chance to continue the pursuit allowed me to persevere under difficult circumstances.

Similarly, obtaining an optimistic mindset on oneself is another strength that I am proud of. Under strenuous circumstances, I believe that I am an entity that possesses silent radiance. In parallel to the fact that an enormous fire is initiated with a mere scintilla, I believe that every individual possesses silent radiance that is on the verge of becoming effulgent. For example, one of the primary stimuli for assiduously studying is to not dissipate the scintilla that is anticipating to burst brilliant light. Through a positive perspective of life, I believe I am able to value my learning experience.

item.title: Activities & Experience
item.description:
Activities & Experience

Table of Contents
  • Leadership
  • Internship
  • Volunteering

Leadership

ChungManHan Holy Phil Orchestra

Jan 2017 - PRESENT • Concertmaster

ChungManHan Holy Phil Orchestra is a church orchestra comprising over 100 members. As the concertmaster of the orchestra, I serve as the primary assistance of the conductor and leader of First Violin.


Mu Alpha Theta at Laurel Springs School

Feb 2026 - PRESENT • Vice President

As the newly appointed Vice President of Laurel Springs School Mu Alpha Theta, I am looking forward to future events!

item.title: Computer Science
item.description:
Competitive Programming

Table of Contents
  • Competitive Programming
    • Learning C++
    • C++ Practice

Competitive Programming

Learning C++

I came to realize that the most common language used in competitive programming is C++ due to its performance and its libraries. Therefore, I decided to learn C++ by reading diverse pages and practicing them through HackerRank Below are my solutions to the problems. Please feel free to suggest better solutions!!


Link to the Challenge:

item.title: Honors
item.description:
Honors & Awards

Table of Contents
  • Academic
  • Volunteering
  • Music
  • Sport

Academic

2025

2025 Korean Mathematical Olympiad Stage I Honorable Mention

Issued by Korean Mathematical Society • Jun 2025

Honorable mentions are awarded to students who scored in approximately top 300 in South Korea.

2025 AMC 10 Top 10%

Issued by Korean Gifted Students Evaluation Association • Jan 2026

The honor is accoladed to students who scored in top 10%.


2024

2024 AMC 8 Honor Roll

Issued by Mathematical Association of America • Feb 2025

Honor Roll is awarded to students who scored in top 5%.

item.title: JavaScript Mini-Projects
item.description:
JavaScript Mini-Projects

Table of Contents
  • 1. Coffee Shop
  • 2. Stopwatch
  • 3. Guess the Number
  • 4. Calculator
  • 5. Rock Paper Scissors
  • 6. Flip a Coin
  • 7. Checklist

Welcome to my JavaScript mini-projects!! Each project consists of three parts: website, source code, and detailed explanation. By researching and reading different articles, I was able to build the projects. To document my though process and to optimistically contribute to the programming community, I wrote a detailed explanation for each script in my personal blog. However, because I was not enrolled in official course for computer science, the scripts may not be in their ideal state. Therefore, please feel free to leave any feedback or comments in my blog for each project for improvements! The entire source code is available here with the original website here!!

Below are the interactive preview of each project. Although responsive components were used to create each project, it may not look pretty in the preview below. Thus, please access each project with the links above!!

item.title: Problem of the Day - 100 Problems for 100 Days
item.description:
Problem of the Day
(100 Problems for 100 Days)

Table of Contents

    Below is the exhaustive list of 100 problems that I explained for the project! The "Video Explanation" button will open an external link to the YouTube video. The "Quick Handwritten Solution" button will open a pdf version of the note that I took while explaining in the respective video. If you are more comfortable with the PDF version of the whole list, here is the link to the file with the entire playlist of the videos available here :) For any corrupted file, feedback, and questions, please do not hesitate to contact me through the contact page!!
